channel.title: How Do I Run the Power Miner Script.?
channel.description:
I need help...I want to run the 'Power Miner' Script and i almost got it but how to execute the program.... it says in here...... [code] execute:/powerMiner([optional bank,][optional walkback,][optional path=int,]id1,id2,idn) [/code] Can you people give me a detailed review about this subject please. there is also one more comment in the "Power Miner" script..
make a text file in Configs/ called paths.txt in there, an entry 0=x1,y1,x2,y2,xn,yn the path needs to start at mine and end at bank specify multiple paths with the path= argument
I want to know more about this too..... Thanks for viewing this......Hope you people out there help me out.... Regards Sky Diploma "The Sky is The Limit" :confused: :)

item.title: How Do I Run the Power Miner Script.?
item.dc:creator: @theman12345 theman12345
item.description:
@theman12345 wrote:

rminePower is a different script

try /powerMiner()

i think its /powerMiner(iron) or /powerMiner(iron,bronze) bronze= pickaxe

Read full topic

item.title: How Do I Run the Power Miner Script.?
item.dc:creator: @sky_diploma sky diploma
item.description:
@sky_diploma wrote:

SO HOW DO I MINE coal ore or mith ore ?
please help me out[br][size=1]Posted at: May 11, 2006, 04:45:27 am[/size][hr]i tried writing…

/rminePower(coal)

but it didnt work…

/rminePower(35)

it didnt work too…

/rminePower(Coal)

this also didnt work…

So what should i use…please help me…

Read full topic

item.title: How Do I Run the Power Miner Script.?
item.dc:creator: @sky_diploma sky diploma
item.description:
@sky_diploma wrote:

I need help…I want to run the ‘Power Miner’ Script and i almost got it but how to execute the program…

it says in here…

execute:/powerMiner([optional bank,][optional walkback,][optional path=int,]id1,id2,idn)

Can you people give me a detailed review about this subject please.

there is also one more comment in the “Power Miner” script…

make a text file in Configs/ called paths.txt in there, an entry 0=x1,y1,x2,y2,xn,yn the path needs to start at mine and end at bank specify multiple paths with the path= argument

I want to know more about this too…

Thanks for viewing this…Hope you people out there help me out…

Regards
Sky Diploma

“The Sky is The Limit”
